name: Tomato
description: The tomato is the edible fruit of Solanum lycopersicum, commonly known as a tomato plant, which belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae

name: Allspice
description: Allspice, also called pimenta, Jamaica pimenta, myrtle pepper, Turkish yenibahar, is the dried unripe fruit of Pimenta dioica.

name: Arborio rice
description: Arborio rice is an Italian short-grain rice. It is named after the town of Arborio, in the Po Valley, which is situated in the main growing region.

name: Ciabatta roll
description: Ciabatta is an Italian white bread made from wheat flour, water, salt, and yeast, created in 1982 by a baker in Verona, Veneto, Italy, in a response to the popularity of French baguettes.

name: Aubergine
description: Eggplant, or aubergine, is a species of nightshade, grown for its edible fruit. Eggplant is the common name in North America, Australia and New Zealand, but British English uses the French word aubergine.

name: Spinach
description: Spinach is an edible flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae native to central and western Asia. Its leaves are eaten as a vegetable.

name: Baby Spinach
description: Spinach is an edible flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae native to central and western Asia. Its leaves are eaten as a vegetable.

name: Balsamic vinegar
description: Balsamic vinegar is a very dark, concentrated, and intensely flavoured vinegar made wholly or partially from grape must, originating in Italy.

name: Red wine vinegar
description: It is used in a variety of dishes to balance the flavors and to add an extra burst of flavor. Following are the few culinary uses of red wine vinegar: Marinades: It is acidic sauce in which meats, fish or vegetables are soaked to induce flavors or tenderize it.

name: Basmati rice
description: Basmati is a variety of long, slender-grained aromatic rice which is traditionally from the Indian subcontinent.

name: Black beans
description: The black turtle bean is a small, shiny variety of common beans, especially popular in Latin American cuisine, though it can also be found in Cajun and Creole cuisines of south Louisiana.

name: Red beans
description: The red turtle bean is a small, shiny variety of common beans, especially popular in Latin American cuisine, though it can also be found in Cajun and Creole cuisines of south Louisiana.

name: Pear
description: The pear is any of several tree and shrub species of genus Pyrus, in the family Rosaceae. It is also the name of the pomaceous fruit of the trees.

name: Chicken Thighs Fillet
description: Thighs on chicken

name: Chicken Thighs
description: Thighs on chicken

name: Chicken Breast Fillet
description: Breast on chicken

name: Chicken Breast Diced
description: Breast on chicken

name: Pork mince
description: Pork

name: Pork strips
description: Pork

name: Broccoli
description: Broccoli is an edible green plant in the cabbage family whose large flowering head is eaten as a vegetable.

name: Brown lentils
description: his is by far the most common variety of lentil, and probably the one that you see at your local grocery store.

name: Brown rice
description: Brown rice is whole grain rice, with the inedible outer hull removed; white rice is the same grain with the hull, bran layer and cereal germ removed.

name: Black rice
description: Black rice has been eaten in regions of Asia for thousands of years; in fact for centuries it was reserved for only Chinese royalty. Rich in antioxidants, fiber and has anti-inflammatory properties.

name: Bulgur wheat
description: Bulgur is a cereal food made from the groats of several different wheat species, most often from durum wheat. Bulgur is a kind of dried cracked wheat.

name: Butter beans
description: Phaseolus lunatus is a legume grown for its edible seeds or beans.

name: Cannellini beans
description: Slightly kidney-shaped with squarish ends, cannellini beans are from Italy and are creamy white in colour. When cooked, they have a fluffy texture.

name: Capers
description: Capparis spinosa, the caper bush, also called Flinders rose, is a perennial plant that bears rounded, fleshy leaves and large white to pinkish-white flowers.

name: Cashew
description: The cashew tree is a tropical evergreen tree that produces the cashew nut and the cashew apple.

name: Carrot
description: The carrot is a root vegetable, usually orange in colour, though purple, black, red, white, and yellow cultivars exist.

name: Celery
description: Celery is a marshland plant in the family Apiaceae that has been cultivated as a vegetable since antiquity. Celery has a long fibrous stalk tapering into leaves.

name: Cheddar cheese
description: Cheddar cheese is a relatively hard, off-white, sometimes sharp-tasting, natural cheese.

name: Chestnut Mushrooms
description: The chestnut mushrooms look like the button mushrooms, but they are colored in a darker nuance. The best chestnut mushrooms are the ones which are a bit curved and open and not flat, with a pink or brownish underside.

name: Common Mushroom
description: Agaricus bisporus is an edible basidiomycete mushroom native to grasslands in Europe and North America. It has two color states while immature—white and brown—both of which have various names.

name: Cherry Tomatoes
description: The black turtle bean is a small, shiny variety of common beans, especially popular in Latin American cuisine, though it can also be found in Cajun and Creole cuisines of south Louisiana.

name: Pak choi
description: Bok choy, known for its mild flavor, is good for stir-fries, braising, and soups. You can also eat it raw. It's an excellent source of vitamin K, vitamin C, vitamin A (in the form of carotenoids), potassium, folate, vitamin B6, calcium and manganese.

name: Pine nuts
description: Pine nuts are the edible seeds of pines. About 20 species of pine produce seeds large enough to be worth harvesting; in other pines the seeds are also edible, but are too small to be of notable value as a human food.

name: Cherry Vinegar
description: Vinegar is a liquid consisting of about 5–20% acetic acid, water, and other trace chemicals, which may include flavorings.

name: Cider Vinegar
description: Vinegar is a liquid consisting of about 5–20% acetic acid, water, and other trace chemicals, which may include flavorings.

name: White Vinegar
description: Vinegar is a liquid consisting of about 5–20% acetic acid, water, and other trace chemicals, which may include flavorings.

name: Common mushroom
description: Agaricus bisporus is an edible basidiomycete mushroom native to grasslands in Europe and North America.

name: Nori
description: Nori is the Japanese name for edible seaweed species of the red algae genus Pyropia, including P. yezoensis and P. tenera.It is made by shredding edible seaweed and then pressing it into thin sheets -- much like the process for making paper.

name: Wasabi
description: Wasabi comes from grating the root Wasabia Japonica. Most of the wasabi you'll find in Japanese restaurants in the United States and even often in Japan is not real wasabi. If you can't get wasabi root, you can make a mock wasabi paste using horseradish.

name: Wholegrain mustard
description: Whole grain mustard is prepared mustard with visible mustard seeds. Look for coarse-ground mustard or stone-ground mustard if you can't find whole grain. Whole grain mustard is sometimes difficult to find, so we've changed that ingredient to stone-ground mustard in our recipes.

name: Chicken stock
description: It is typically made from dehydrated vegetables, meat stock, a small portion of fat, MSG, salt and seasonings, shaped into a small cube. Vegetarian and vegan types are also made. Bouillon is also available in both granular or powdered form.

name: Vegetable stock
description: It is typically made from dehydrated vegetables, meat stock, a small portion of fat, MSG, salt and seasonings, shaped into a small cube. Vegetarian and vegan types are also made. Bouillon is also available in both granular or powdered form.

name: Canned tomato
description: Canned tomatoes, or tinned tomatoes, are tomatoes, usually peeled, that are sealed into a can after having been processed by heat..

name: Cinnamon
description: Cinnamon is a spice obtained from the inner bark of several tree species from the genus Cinnamomum. Cinnamon is used in both sweet and savoury foods.

name: Clotted cream
description: Cream

name: Conchiglie
description: Conchiglie, commonly known as shells or seashells is a type of pasta. It is usually sold in the plain durum wheat variety, and also in colored varieties which use natural pigments, such as tomato extract, squid ink or spinach extract..

name: Linguine
description: Linguine is a form of pasta – like fettuccine and trenette, but elliptical in section rather than flat. It is about 4 millimetres in width, which is wider than spaghetti but not as wide as fettuccine

name: Lasagne sheets
description: Lasagne are wide, flat-shaped pasta, and possibly one of the oldest types of pasta.

name: Wheat noodles
description: Whole wheat contains three parts of the grain—the bran (the grain’s outer layer), the germ the sprouting section of the seed, and the endosperm, the large starchy center.

name: Chipotle paste
description: Chipotle paste is made with adobo chipotles, plain yoghurt or Mexican crema, garlic and lime juice. Chipotles are actually smoked jalapenos.

name: Chopped dates
description: Dates des

name: Beetroot
description: The beetroot is the taproot portion of the beet plant, usually known in North America as the beet, also table beet, garden beet, red beet, or golden beet.

name: Corn lettuce
description: Valerianella locusta is a small annual plant that is eaten as a leaf vegetable. It has a characteristic nutty flavor, dark green color, and soft texture, and is popularly served as salad greens.

name: Arugula
description: Eruca sativa is an edible annual plant, commonly known as rocket salad or arugula; other names include rucola, rucoli, rugula, colewort, and roquette.

name: Mixed leaf salad
description: A salad is a dish consisting of a mixture of small pieces of food, usually featuring vegetables.They are typically served at room temperature or chilled, with notable exceptions such as south German potato salad which is served warm.

name: Cornflour
description: Cornflour, cornstarch or maize is the starch derived from the corn grain or wheat.

name: Couscous
description: Couscous is a Maghrebi dish of small steamed balls of crushed durum wheat semolina, usually served with a stew spooned on top.

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumber is a widely cultivated plant in the gourd family, Cucurbitaceae. It is a creeping vine that bears cucumiform fruits that are used as vegetables.

name: Bay leaf
description: Bay leaf refers to the aromatic leaves of several plants used in cooking. These include: Bay laurel. Fresh or dried bay leaves are used in cooking for their distinctive flavor and fragrance.

name: Dried cranberries
description: Dried cranberries are made by partially dehydrating fresh cranberries, a process similar to making grapes into raisins.

name: Dried oregano
description: It is native to temperate western and southwestern Eurasia and the Mediterranean region.

name: Thyme
description: Thyme is an aromatic perennial evergreen herb with culinary, medicinal, and ornamental uses. The most common variety is Thymus vulgaris.

name: Dried Thyme
description: Thyme is an aromatic perennial evergreen herb with culinary, medicinal, and ornamental uses. The most common variety is Thymus vulgaris.

name: Egg boiled
description: Eggs are laid by female animals of many different species, including birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish, and have been eaten by humans for thousands of years.

name: Egg fried
description: Eggs are laid by female animals of many different species, including birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish, and have been eaten by humans for thousands of years.

name: Feta cheese
description: Feta is a brined curd white cheese made in Greece from sheep's milk, or from a mixture of sheep and goat's milk.

name: Crab meat
description: Crab meat or crabmeat is the meat found within a crab. It is used in many cuisines across the world, prized for its soft, delicate, sweet taste.

name: Fish sauce
description: Fish sauce is a condiment made from fermented fish and salt. It is used as a staple ingredient in various cuisines.

name: Coconut Cream
description: Coconut cream is very similar to coconut milk but contains less water. The difference is mainly consistency. It has a thicker, more paste-like consistency, while coconut milk is generally a liquid.

name: Dessicated coconut
description: Dessicated coconut is coconut meat which has been shredded or flaked and then dried to remove as much moisture as possible.

name: Basil
description: culinary herb of the family Lamiaceae. It is also called the king of herbs and the royal herb.

name: Chives
description: Chives is the common name of Allium schoenoprasum, an edible species of the Allium genus.

name: Coriander
description: Coriander, also known as cilantro or Chinese parsley, is an annual herb in the family Apiaceae.

name: Ginger
description: Ginger is a flowering plant whose rhizome, ginger root or simply ginger, is widely used as a spice or a folk medicine.

name: Mint
description: Mints are aromatic, almost exclusively perennial, rarely annual herbs.

name: Parsley
description: Parsley or garden parsley is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae, native to the central Mediterranean region, naturalized elsewhere in Europe

name: Rosemary
description: Rosmarinus officinalis, commonly known as rosemary, is a woody, perennial herb with fragrant, evergreen, needle-like leaves and white, pink, purple, or blue flowers.

name: Sage
description: Salvia officinalis is a perennial, evergreen subshrub, with woody stems, grayish leaves, and blue to purplish flowers.

name: Tarragon
description: Tarragon, also known as estragon, is a species of perennial herb in the sunflower family. It is widespread in the wild across much of Eurasia and North America.

name: Garden Peas
description: The pea is most commonly the small spherical seed or the seed-pod of the pod fruit Pisum sativum. Each pod contains several peas.

name: Kale
description: Kale or leaf cabbage refers to certain vegetable cultivars of the plant species Brassica oleracea. A kale plant has green or purple leaves and the central leaves do not form a head.

name: Lemon
description: The lemon, Citrus limon Osbeck, is a species of small evergreen tree in the flowering plant family Rutaceae, native to Asia.

name: Lemongrass
description: Cymbopogon, better known as lemongrass, is a genus of Asian, African, Australian, and tropical island plants in the grass family. Some species are commonly cultivated as culinary and medicinal herbs because of their scent, resembling that of lemons.

name: Garlic
description: Garlic is a species in the onion genus, Allium. Its close relatives include the onion, shallot, leek, chive, and Chinese onion.

name: Lime
description: A lime is a hybrid citrus fruit, which is typically round, lime green, 3–6 centimetres in diameter, and containing acidic juice vesicles

name: Mange tout
description: Snap peas, also known as sugar snap peas, are a cultivar group of edible-podded peas that differ from snow peas in that their pods are round as opposed to flat.

name: Gnocchi
description: Phaseolus lunatus is a legume grown for its edible seeds or beans.

name: Goat cheese
description: Goat cheese, goats' cheese, or chèvre, is cheese made from goat's milk.

name: Halloumi
description: It is a Cypriot semi-hard, unripened, brined cheese made from a mixture of goat's and sheep's milk, and sometimes also cow's milk. It has a high melting point and so can easily be fried or grilled.

name: Greek yogurt
description: Strained yogurt, Greek yogurt, yogurt cheese, or labneh, is yogurt that has been strained to remove its whey, resulting in a thicker consistency than unstrained yogurt.

name: Green beans
description: Green beans are the unripe, young fruit and protective pods of various cultivars of the common bean. Immature or young pods of the runner bean, yardlong bean, and hyacinth bean are used in a similar way.

name: Green pepper
description: The bell pepper is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivars of the plant produce fruits in different colors.

name: Red pepper
description: The bell pepper is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivars of the plant produce fruits in different colors.

name: Yellow pepper
description: The bell pepper is a cultivar group of the species Capsicum annuum. Cultivars of the plant produce fruits in different colors.

name: Ground coriander
description: Coriander, also known as cilantro or Chinese parsley, is an annual herb in the family Apiaceae. All parts of the plant are edible, but the fresh leaves and the dried seeds are the parts most traditionally used in cooking.

name: Paprika
description: Paprika is a ground spice made from red air-dried fruits of the larger and sweeter varieties of the plant Capsicum annuum, called bell pepper or sweet pepper, sometimes with the addition of more pungent

name: Cayenne pepper
description: The cayenne pepper, also known as the Guinea spice, cow-horn pepper, red hot chili pepper, aleva, bird pepper, or, especially in its powdered form, red pepper, is a cultivar of Capsicum annuum

name: Pea shoots
description: It is cultivated worldwide as a semiarid crop. Its seeds and its leaves are common ingredients in dishes from South Asia.

name: Peanut butter
description: Peanut butter is a food paste or spread made from ground dry roasted peanuts. It often contains additional ingredients that modify the taste or texture, such as salt, sweeteners or emulsifiers.

name: Peanut
description: The peanut, also known as the groundnut and the goober and taxonomically classified as Arachis hypogaea, is a legume crop grown mainly for its edible seeds.

name: Pineapple
description: The pineapple is a tropical plant with an edible multiple fruit consisting of coalesced berries, also called pineapples, and the most economically significant plant in the Bromeliaceae family.

name: Black olives
description: The olive, known by the botanical name Olea europaea, meaning European olive, is a species of small tree in the family Oleaceae, found in the Mediterranean Basin from Portugal to the Levant.

name: Pomegranate
description: The pomegranate, botanical name Punica granatum, is a fruit-bearing deciduous shrub or small tree in the family Lythraceae that grows between 5 and 8 m tall.

name: Pork loin
description: Pork loin is a cut of meat from a pig, created from the tissue along the top of the rib cage.

name: Pork tenderloinloin
description: The pork tenderloin, also called pork fillet, is a long thin cut of pork. As with all quadrupeds, the tenderloin refers to the psoas major muscle along the central spine portion, ventral to the lumbar vertebrae.

name: Portobello mushrooms
description: Agaricus bisporus is an edible basidiomycete mushroom native to grasslands in Europe and North America. It has two color states while immature—white and brown—both of which have various names.

name: Potatoes
description: The potato is a starchy, tuberous crop from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum. The word potato may refer either to the plant itself or to the edible tuber.

name: Waxy Potatoes
description: The potato is a starchy, tuberous crop from the perennial nightshade Solanum tuberosum. The word potato may refer either to the plant itself or to the edible tuber.

name: Pumpkin seed
description: Pumpkin seed, also known as pepita, are the edible seeds of a pumpkin or certain other cultivars of squash.

name: Quinoa
description: Quinoa is the common name for Chenopodium quinoa, a flowering plant in the amaranth family Amaranthaceae.

name: Ras el hanout
description: Ras el hanout or Rass el hanout is a spice mix from North Africa. It plays a similar role in North African cuisine as garam masala does in Indian cuisine.

name: Chili pepper
description: The chili pepper is the fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae.

name: Red onion
description: Red onions, are cultivars of the onion, with purplish red skin and white flesh tinged with red. These onions tend to be medium to large in size and have a mild, to sweet flavor.

name: Parmigiano Reggiano
description: Parmesan cheese, is a hard, granular cheese. The name Parmesan is often used generically for various simulations of this cheese,

name: Rice vinegar
description: Rice vinegar is a vinegar made from fermented rice in China, Japan, Korea, and Vietnam.

name: Saffron
description: Saffron is a spice derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, commonly known as the saffron crocus.

name: Sesame
description: Sesame is a flowering plant in the genus Sesamum, also called benne. Numerous wild relatives occur in Africa and a smaller number in India.

name: Shallot
description: The shallot is a type of onion, specifically a botanical variety of the species Allium cepa.

name: Bacon
description: Bacon is a meat product prepared from cured pork. It is first cured using large quantities of salt, either a brine or a dry packing.

name: Soy sauce
description: Soy sauce is a condiment made from a fermented paste of boiled soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and Aspergillus oryzae or Aspergillus sojae molds.

name: Spring onion
description: Scallion, green onion, spring onion and salad onion are English names for various Allium species.

name: Stilton cheese
description: Stilton is an English cheese, produced in two varieties: Blue, known for its characteristic strong smell and taste, and the lesser-known White.

name: Sultanas
description: The sultana is a white, oval seedless grape variety also called the sultanina, Thompson Seedless, Lady de Coverly, and oval-fruited Kishmish.

name: Sun-dried tomatos
description: Sun-dried tomatoes are ripe tomatoes that lose most of their water content after spending a majority of their drying time in the sun.

name: Tofu
description: Tofu, also known as bean curd, is a food cultivated by coagulating soy milk and then pressing the resulting curds into soft white blocks. It is a component in East Asian, Southeast Asian and West African cuisines.

name: Sweet potato
description: The sweet potato is a dicotyledonous plant that belongs to the family Convolvulaceae. Its large, starchy, sweet-tasting, tuberous roots are a root vegetable.

name: Sweet corn
description: Sweet corn is a variety of maize with a high sugar content. Sweet corn is the result of a naturally occurring recessive mutation in the genes which control conversion of sugar to starch inside the endosperm of the corn kernel.

name: Chickpeas
description: The chickpea or chick pea is a legume of the family Fabaceae, subfamily Faboideae. Its different types are variously known as gram, or Bengal gram, garbanzo or garbanzo bean, Egyptian pea.

name: Tomato paste
description: Tomato paste is a thick paste made by cooking tomatoes for several hours to reduce the water content.

name: Truffles
description: A truffle is the fruiting body of a subterranean Ascomycete fungus, predominantly one of the many species of the genus Tuber.

name: Tuna
description: A tuna is a saltwater fish that belongs to the tribe Thunnini, a sub-grouping of the mackerel family.

name: Turmeric
description: Turmeric is a rhizomatous herbaceous perennial plant of the ginger family, Zingiberaceae.

name: Vanilla
description: Vanilla is a flavoring derived from orchids of the genus Vanilla, primarily from the Mexican species, flat-leaved vanilla.

name: Horseradish
description: Horseradish is a perrenial plant of the Brassicaceae family. It is a root vegetable used as a spice. The plant is probably native to southeastern Europe and western Asia.

name: Minced lamb
description: Lamb, hogget, and mutton are the meat of domestic sheep at different ages. A sheep in its first year is called a lamb just like its meat.

name: Walnuts
description: A walnut is the nut of any tree of the genus Juglans, particularly the Persian or English walnut, Juglans regia.

name: Wrap
description: A wrap is made with a soft flatbread rolled around a filling. The usual flatbreads are wheat-flour tortillas, lavash, or pita.

name: Breadcrumbs
description: A wrap is made with a soft flatbread rolled around a filling. The usual flatbreads are wheat-flour tortillas, lavash, or pita.

name: Mango chutney
description: Chutney is a sauce in the cuisines of the Indian subcontinent that can include such forms as tomato relish, a ground peanut garnish or a yoghurt, cucumber and mint dip.

name: Mayonnaise
description: Mayonnaise is a thick, creamy dressing often used as a condiment. It is a stable emulsion of oil, egg yolk, and either vinegar or lemon juice, with many options for embellishment with other herbs and spices.

name: Harissa paste
description: Harissa is a Maghrebi hot chilli pepper paste, the main ingredients of which are roasted red peppers, Baklouti pepper, serrano peppers, and other hot chilli peppers and spices and herbs such as garlic.

name: Miso paste
description: Miso is a traditional Japanese seasoning produced by fermetning soybeans with salt and koji and sometimes rice, barley or other ingredients.

name: Dijon mustard
description: A traditional mustard of France, named after the town of Dijon in Burgundy, France, which was  a centre of mustard making in the late Middle Ages and was granted exclusive rights in France in the 17th century.

name: Honey
description: Honey is a sweet, viscous food substance produced by bees and some related insects. Bees produce honey from the sugary secretions of plants or other insects trough regurgitation, enzymatic activity and water evaporation.

name: Curry powder
description: Curry powder is a spice mix of widely varying composition based on South Asian cuisine.

name: Curry paste
description: Curry paste is a mixture of curry powder and water, coriander seeds, cumin, mustard, fennel, turmeric, cinnamon, paprika etc.

name: Red curry paste
description: Curry paste is a spice mix of widely varying composition based on South Asian cuisine.

name: Ground fenugreek
description: Fenugreek seeds are mainly found in Middle Eastern cooking and are a popular ingredient in curries and chutneys. The hard, dense seeds can be difficult to grind at home, so this fine powder is a handy way to include fenugreek in cooking.

name: Chorizo
description: Chorizo is a type of pork sausage. Traditionally, it uses natural casings made from intestines, a method used since Roman times.

name: Gem Lettuce
description: Lettuce is an annual plant of the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is most often grown as a leaf vegetable, but sometimes for its stem and seeds.

name: Onion
description: The onion, also known as the bulb onion or common onion, is a vegetable and is the most widely cultivated species of the genus Allium.

name: Pineapple
description: The pineapple is a tropical plant with an edible multiple fruit consisting of coalesced berries, also called pineapples, and the most economically significant plant in the Bromeliaceae family.

name: Red grapes
description: A grape is a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis. Grapes contain powerful antioxidants known as polyphenols, which may slow or prevent many types of cancer, including esophageal, lung, mouth, pharynx, endometrial, pancreatic, prostate and colon

name: Red Chilli
description: The chili pepper is the fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. They are widely used in many cuisines to add spiciness to dishes.

name: Chilli jam
description: The chili pepper is the fruit of plants from the genus Capsicum, members of the nightshade family, Solanaceae. They are widely used in many cuisines to add spiciness to dishes.

name: Chilli flakes
description: Crushed red pepper or red pepper flakes is a condiment consisting of dried and crushed red chili peppers.

name: Courgette
description: Zucchini or courgette is a summer squash which can reach nearly a meter in length, but is usually harvested immature at 15 to 25 cm.

name: Paneer
description: Paneer is a fresh cheese common in South Asia, especially in Indian, Pakistani, Afghan, Nepali, Sri Lankan, and Bangladeshi cuisines.

name: Sausage
description: A sausage is a cylindrical meat product usually made from ground meat, often pork, beef, or veal, along with salt, spices and other flavourings, and breadcrumbs, with a skin around it.

name: Apple
description: The apple tree is a deciduous tree in the rose family best known for its sweet, pomaceous fruit, the apple. It is cultivated worldwide as a fruit tree, and is the most widely grown species in the genus Malus.

name: Pecan nuts
description: The pecan is a species of hickory native to Mexico and the southcentral and southeastern regions of the United States.

name: Leek
description: The leek is a vegetable, a cultivar of Allium ampeloprasum, the broadleaf wild leek. The edible part of the plant is a bundle of leaf sheaths that is sometimes erroneously called a stem or stalk.

name: Leek
description: The leek is a vegetable, a cultivar of Allium ampeloprasum, the broadleaf wild leek. The edible part of the plant is a bundle of leaf sheaths that is sometimes erroneously called a stem or stalk.

name: Dill
description: Dill is an annual herb in the celery family Apiaceae. It is the only species in the genus Anethum. Dill is widely grown in Eurasia where its leaves and seeds are used as a herb or spice for flavouring food.

name: Artichoke heart
description: The globe artichoke is a variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food. The edible portion of the plant consists of the flower buds before the flowers come into bloom.

name: Ground cumin
description: The globe artichoke is a variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food. The edible portion of the plant consists of the flower buds before the flowers come into bloom.

name: Salmon
description: Salmon is the common name for several species of ray-finned fish in the family Salmonidae. Other fish in the same family include trout, char, grayling and whitefish.

name: Haddock
description: Haddock is a very popular food fish, sold fresh, smoked, frozen, dried, or to a small extent canned. Haddock, along with Atlantic cod and plaice, is one of the most popular fish used in British fish and chips. Fresh haddock has clean, white flesh and can be cooked in the same ways as cod.

name: Mackerel
description: Mackerel is an important food fish that is consumed worldwide. As an oily fish, it is a rich source of omega-3 fatty acids. The flesh of mackerel spoils quickly, especially in the tropics, and can cause scombroid food poisoning.

name: Pangasius
description: Pangasius is a genus of medium-large to very large shark catfishes native to fresh water in South and Southeast Asia. It is farmed in large numbers in pens around the Mekong River system of Vietnam, as well as in China and Cambodia.

name: Smoked Trout
description: Trout is the common name for a number of species of freshwater fish belonging to the genera Oncorhynchus, Salmo and Salvelinus, all of the subfamily Salmoninae of the family Salmonidae.

name: Steak
description: A steak is a meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, potentially including a bone.

name: Smoked bacon
description: A steak is a meat generally sliced across the muscle fibers, potentially including a bone.

name: Orange
description: Fruit of the citrus species Citrus sinensis in the family Rutaceae. It is also called sweet orange, to distinguish it from the related Citrus × aurantium, referred to as bitter orange.

name: Oats
description: The oat, sometimes called the common oat, is a species of cereal grain grown for its seed, which is known by the same name. While oats are suitable for human consumption as oatmeal and rolled oats, one of the most common uses is as livestock feed.

name: Butternut squash
description: Butternut squash, sometimes known in Australia and New Zealand as butternut pumpkin or gramma, is a type of winter squash that grows on a vine. It has a sweet, nutty taste similar to that of a pumpkin.

name: Pancetta
description: Pancetta is an Italian bacon made of pork belly meat, that is salt cured and spiced with black pepper, and sometimes other spices. Pancetta in Italy is often consumed raw.

name: Baharat
description: Bahārāt is a spice mixture or blend used in Middle Eastern cuisine. Bahārāt is the Arabic word for 'spices'. The mixture of finely ground spices is often used to season lamb, fish, chicken, beef, and soups and may be used as a condiment.

name: Pine nuts
description: Pine nuts are the edible seeds of pines. About 20 species of pine produce seeds large enough to be worth harvesting; in other pines the seeds are also edible, but are too small to be of notable value as a human food.

name: Nigella seeds
description: Nigella sativa, often called black cumin, is an annual flowering plant in the family Ranunculaceae, native to south and southwest Asia. Nigella sativa grows to 20-30 cm tall, with finely divided, linear leaves.

name: Sesame Oil
description: Sesame oil is an edible vegetable oil derived from sesame seeds. Besides being used as a cooking oil in South India, it is often used as a flavour enhancer in Korean, Chinese, Japanese, Middle Eastern, and Southeast Asian cuisine.

name: Shaoxing Wine
description: Shaoxing wine is one of the most famous varieties of huangjiu, or traditional Chinese wines, fermented from rice. It originates from the region of Shaoxing, in the Zhejiang province of eastern China.

name: Pork Neck
description: Pork meat

name: Cardamom pods
description: Cardamom, sometimes Cardamon or Cardamum, is a spice made from the seeds of several plants in the genera Elettaria and Amomum in the family Zingiberaceae. Both genera are native to India, Bhutan, Indonesia and Nepal.

name: Saffron
description: Saffron is a spice derived from the flower of Crocus sativus, commonly known as the saffron crocus. The vivid crimson stigmas and styles, called threads, are collected and dried to be used mainly as a seasoning and colouring agent in food.

name: Tahini
description: Tahini, also known as Ardeh, is a condiment made from toasted ground hulled sesame seeds. Tahini is served as a dip on its own or as a major component of hummus, baba ghanoush, and halva.

name: Pistachio
description: The pistachio, a member of the cashew family, is a small tree originating from Central Asia and the Middle East. The tree produces seeds that are widely consumed as food.

name: Anchovy
description: An anchovy is a small, common salt-water forage fish of the family Engraulidae. The 144 species are placed in 17 genera; they are found in the Atlantic, Indian and Pacific Oceans, and in the Black Sea and the Mediterranean Sea.

name: Sour Cream
description: Sour cream is a dairy product obtained by fermenting regular cream with certain kinds of lactic acid bacteria. The bacterial culture, which is introduced either deliberately or naturally, sours and thickens the cream.

name: Double Cream
description: Double cream is a very thick cream that can be served as is with fruit, pies, cake, puddings, etc. It can not only be whipped, it will whip up firmer than whipping cream, which is why fancy cake makers will prefer it to whipping cream.

name: Hoisin Sauce
description: Hoisin sauce is a thick, pungent sauce commonly used in Chinese cuisine as a glaze for meat, an addition to stir fries, or as dipping sauce. It is darkly colored in appearance and sweet and salty in taste.

name: Yoghurt
description: Yogurt, yoghurt, or yoghourt is a food produced by bacterial fermentation of milk. The bacteria used to make yogurt are known as yogurt cultures.

name: Sumac
description: The sumac bush, native to the Middle East, produces deep red berries, which are dried and ground into coarse powder. The spice was long used in Europe to add tartness to many dishes until the Romans introduced lemons to the area.

name: Mozzarella
description: Mozzarella is a traditionally southern Italian dairy product made from Italian buffalo's milk by the pasta filata method. Mozzarella received a Traditional Specialities Guaranteed certification from the European Union in 1998.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cauliflower is one of several vegetables in the species Brassica oleracea in the genus Brassica, which is in the family Brassicaceae. It is an annual plant that reproduces by seed.

name: Brussels sprout
description: The Brussels sprout is a member of the Gemmifera Group of cabbages, grown for its edible buds. The leafy green vegetables are typically 2.5–4 cm in diameter and look like miniature cabbages.

name: Tamarind paste
description: Tamarind is a leguminous tree in the family Fabaceae indigenous to tropical Africa. The genus Tamarindus is a monotypic taxon, having only a single species.

name: Radish
description: The radish is an edible root vegetable of the Brassicaceae family that was domesticated in Europe in pre-Roman times. Radishes are grown and consumed throughout the world, being mostly eaten raw as a crunchy salad vegetable.

name: Lime Leaf
description: The kaffir lime, sometimes referred to in English as the makrut lime or Mauritius papeda, is a citrus fruit native to tropical Asia, including India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines.

name: Ketchup
description: Ketchup is a table sauce. Traditionally, recipes featured ketchups made from egg whites, mushrooms, oysters, mussels, walnuts, or other foods, but in modern times the unmodified term usually refers to tomato ketchup.

name: Fig relish
description: Fig relish is a jam made out of fresh figs and caramelized onions as main ingredients, while honey, apples, vinegar, sultanas, nutmeg and others add up to the taste.

name: Cabbage
description: Cabbage or headed cabbage is a leafy green or purple biennial plant, grown as an annual vegetable crop for its dense-leaved heads.

name: Dried Apricot
description: An apricot is a fruit, or the tree that bears the fruit, of several species in the genus Prunus. Usually, an apricot tree is from the species P. armeniaca.

name: Fennel seeds
description: An apricot is a fruit, or the tree that bears the fruit, of several species in the genus Prunus. Usually, an apricot tree is from the species P. armeniaca.

name: Plum
description: A plum is a fruit of the subgenus Prunus of the genus Prunus. The subgenus is distinguished from other subgenera in the shoots having terminal bud and solitary side buds.

name: King prawns
description: Prawn is a common name for small aquatic crustaceans with an exoskeleton and ten legs, some of which can be eaten.

name: Almonds
description: The almond is a species of tree native to the Middle East, the Indian subcontinent and North Africa.

name: Ajvar
description: Ajvar is a pepper-based condiment made principally from red bell peppers. It may also contain garlic, eggplant and chili peppers.

name: Arancini
description: Succade is the candied peel of any of the citrus species, especially from the citron or Citrus medica which is distinct with its extra thick peel; in addition, the taste of the inner rind of the citron is less bitter than those of the other citrus.

name: Aronia
description: Aronia is a genus of deciduous shrubs, the chokeberries, in the family Rosaceae native to eastern North America and most commonly found in wet woods and swamps.

name: Aronia powder
description: Aronia is a genus of deciduous shrubs, the chokeberries, in the family Rosaceae native to eastern North America and most commonly found in wet woods and swamps.

name: Aronia jam
description: Aronia is a genus of deciduous shrubs, the chokeberries, in the family Rosaceae native to eastern North America and most commonly found in wet woods and swamps.

name: Arugula
description: Arugula or rocket is an edible annual plant. It is also called rocket salad, rucola, rucoli, rugula, colewort, and roquette.

name: Avocado
description: The avocado is a tree, long thought to have originated in South Central Mexico, classified as a member of the flowering plant family Lauraceae.

name: Banana
description: The banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa. In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called plantains, in contrast to dessert bananas.

name: Blueberries
description: Blueberries are perennial flowering plants with indigo-colored berries. They are classified in the section Cyanococcus within the genus Vaccinium. Vaccinium also includes cranberries, bilberries and grouseberries.

name: Bread
description: Bread is a staple food prepared from a dough of flour and water, usually by baking. Throughout recorded history it has been popular around the world and is one of the oldest artificial foods, having been of importance since the dawn of agriculture.

name: Butter
description: Butter is a dairy product containing up to 80% butterfat which is solid when chilled and at room temperature in some regions and liquid when warmed.

name: Cabbage
description: Cabbage or headed cabbage is a leafy green or purple biennial plant, grown as an annual vegetable crop for its dense-leaved heads.

name: Cherry
description: A cherry is the fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe. The cherry fruits of commerce usually are obtained from cultivars of a limited number of species such as the sweet cherry and the sour cherry.

name: Chocolate protein powder
description: A cherry is the fruit of many plants of the genus Prunus, and is a fleshy drupe. The cherry fruits of commerce usually are obtained from cultivars of a limited number of species such as the sweet cherry and the sour cherry.

name: Cocoa
description: The cocoa bean, also called cacao bean, cocoa, and cacao, is the dried and fully fermented seed of Theobroma cacao, from which cocoa solids and, because of the seed's fat, cocoa butter can be extracted.

name: Cod
description: Cod is the common name for the genus Gadus of demersal fishes, belonging to the family Gadidae. Cod is also used as part of the common name for a number of other fish species, and some species suggested to belong to genus Gadus are not called cod.

name: Dried cranberry
description: Dried cranberries are made by partially dehydrating fresh cranberries, a process similar to making grapes into raisins. They are popular in trail mix, salads, and breads, with cereals or eaten on their own.

name: Cranberry
description: Cranberries are a group of evergreen dwarf shrubs or trailing vines in the subgenus Oxycoccus of the genus Vaccinium.

name: Creme fraiche
description: Crème fraîche is a dairy product, a soured cream containing 10–45% butterfat, with a pH of around 4.5. It is soured with a bacterial culture. European labeling regulations disallow any ingredients other than cream and bacterial culture.

name: Pork rind
description: Pork rind is the culinary term for the skin of a pig. It can also be fried or roasted in pork fat as a snack

name: Dried plums
description: Pork rind is the culinary term for the skin of a pig. It can also be fried or roasted in pork fat as a snack

name: Fidelini
description: Fidelini is a type of pasta that is commonly used for soups.

name: Fig relish
description: Ficus carica is an Asian species of flowering plant in the mulberry family, known as the common fig. It is the source of the fruit also called the fig, and as such is an important crop in those areas where it is grown commercially.

name: Flaxseed
description: Flax, also known as common flax or linseed, is a member of the genus Linum in the family Linaceae. It is a food and fiber crop cultivated in cooler regions of the world.

name: Fusili
description: Fusilli are a variety of pasta that are formed into corkscrew or helical shapes. The word fusilli presumably comes from fuso, as traditionally it is spun by pressing and rolling a small rod over the thin strips of pasta to wind them around it in a corkscrew shape.

name: Garden cress
description: Cress, sometimes referred to as garden cress to distinguish it from similar plants also referred to as cress, is a rather fast-growing, edible herb.

name: Garden cress
description: Cress, sometimes referred to as garden cress to distinguish it from similar plants also referred to as cress, is a rather fast-growing, edible herb.

name: Hazelnut
description: The hazelnut is the nut of the hazel and therefore includes any of the nuts deriving from species of the genus Corylus, especially the nuts of the species Corylus avellana. It also is known as cobnut or filbert nut according to species.

name: Jalapeno
description: The jalapeño is a medium-sized chili pepper pod type cultivar of the species Capsicum annuum. A mature jalapeño fruit is 5–10 cm long and hangs down with a round, firm, smooth flesh of 25–38 mm wide.

name: Chard
description: Chard or Swiss chard is a green leafy vegetable that can be used in Mediterranean cooking. In the cultivars of the Flavescens-Group, the leaf stalks are large and often prepared separately from the leaf blade.

name: Melon
description: A melon is any of various plants of the family Cucurbitaceae with sweet edible, fleshy fruit. The word melon can refer to either the plant or specifically to the fruit. Botanically, a melon is a kind of berry, specifically a pepo.

name: Milk
description: Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals. It is the primary source of nutrition for infant mammals before they are able to digest other types of food.

name: Mlinci
description: Mlinci is a dish in Croatian, Serbian and Slovenian cuisine. It is a thin dried flatbread that is easy to prepare by simply pouring boiled salted water or soup over the mlinci.

name: Olive oil
description: Olive oil is a liquid fat obtained from olives, a traditional tree crop of the Mediterranean Basin. The oil is produced by pressing whole olives. It is commonly used in cooking, whether for frying or as a salad dressing.

name: Peach
description: The peach is a deciduous tree native to the region of Northwest China between the Tarim Basin and the north slopes of the Kunlun Shan mountains, where it was first domesticated and cultivated.

name: Pickle
description: A pickled cucumber is a cucumber that has been pickled in a brine, vinegar, or other solution and left to ferment for a period of time, by either immersing the cucumbers in an acidic solution or through souring by lacto-fermentation.

name: Prosciutto
description: Prosciutto is an Italian dry-cured ham that is usually thinly sliced and served uncooked; this style is called prosciutto crudo in Italian and is distinguished from cooked ham, prosciutto cotto.

name: Radicchio
description: Radicchio is a cultivated form of leaf chicory, sometimes known as Italian chicory, and is a perennial. It is grown as a leaf vegetable which usually has white-veined red leaves.

name: Raspberry
description: The raspberry is the edible fruit of a multitude of plant species in the genus Rubus of the rose family, most of which are in the subgenus Idaeobatus; the name also applies to these plants themselves. Raspberries are perennial with woody stems.

name: Red cabbage
description: The red cabbage is a kind of cabbage, also known as purple cabbage, red kraut, or blue kraut after preparation. Its leaves are coloured dark red/purple.

name: Sheep cheese
description: Sheep milk cheese is a cheese prepared from sheep milk. Well-known cheeses made from sheep milk include the Feta of Greece, Roquefort of France, Manchego from Spain, the Pecorino Romano and Ricotta of Italy.

name: Skripavac cheese
description: This cheese was named for the sound it makes in your mouth when it scratches over your teeth. Oftenly it is made from cows milk, in rare cases from sheeps.

name: Squash flour
description: Butternut Squash flour is a sweet and irresistible flour perfectly suited to replace all-purpose flour. If you have not tasted fresh butternut squash flour before, you don't know what you are missing.

name: Squash seed
description: A pumpkin seed, also known as a pepita, is the edible seed of a pumpkin or certain other cultivars of squash. The seeds are typically rather flat and asymmetrically oval, and light green in color and may have a white outer hull.

name: Summer savory
description: Summer savory is among the best known of the savory species. It is an annual, but otherwise is similar in use and flavor to the perennial winter savory. It is used more often than winter savory, which has a slightly more bitter flavor.

name: Watermelon
description: Watermelon is a scrambling and trailing vine in the flowering plant family Cucurbitaceae. The species originated in southern Africa, with evidence of its cultivation in Ancient Egypt.
